pinyin: zuìwēng zhī yì bù zài jiǔ
english: the real intention is not in the wine

etymology.description: 醉翁 + 之意 + 不在 + 酒 = the drunk old man's intention is not in the wine.
etymology.interpretation: From Ouyang Xiu’s Zuiweng Pavilion Essay, saying the drinker’s heart lies in the scenery and company rather than the wine. Now used to imply someone’s stated focus is a pretext and their true aim lies elsewhere.

parts.english: drunkard; elderly drinker; the Drunken Old Man (Ouyang Xiu)
not lie in; not be at; not located in

examples.chinese: 他总请客吃饭(他總請客吃飯)，醉翁之意不在酒(醉翁之意不在酒)，其实是想谈合作(其實是想談合作)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zǒng qǐngkè chīfàn, zuìwēng zhī yì bù zài jiǔ, qíshí shì xiǎng tán hézuò.
examples.english: He often treats others to meals; the real intention isn’t the food or drink—he actually wants to discuss cooperation.

examples.chinese: 商家搞低价促销(商家搞低價促銷)，醉翁之意不在酒(醉翁之意不在酒)，目的是抢占市场份额(目的是搶佔市場份額)。
examples.pinyin: Shāngjiā gǎo dījià cùxiāo, zuìwēng zhī yì bù zài jiǔ, mùdì shì qiǎngzhàn shìchǎng fèn'é.
examples.english: The merchant runs low-price promotions; the true aim isn’t the discount but to seize market share.

examples.chinese: 他说来旅游(他說來旅遊)，醉翁之意不在酒(醉翁之意不在酒)，是想见老朋友(是想見老朋友)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shuō lái lǚyóu, zuìwēng zhī yì bù zài jiǔ, shì xiǎng jiàn lǎo péngyou.
examples.english: He said he came to travel; in fact, his real intention was to meet old friends.
